Dear Mr. Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616)204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
1

(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff threw Youth A to the ground during the act of attempting a
restraint.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 03/21/2023 and did not
have any additional information to provide.
Administrator 1 was interviewed on 03/21/2023 during an
unannounced face-to-face visit to the facility. An overview of the
incident in question was discussed and information was provided
regarding the facility restraint model, staff and youth involved as
well as documentation that would be needed for the investigation.
Youth A was interviewed on 04/04/2023 during an announced
face-to-face visit to the facility. He stated that he had been placed
at the facility for approximately a month. Youth A confirmed that
he was involved in the incident in question. He stated that the
entire incident had started prior to the youth returning to their unit,
when they were in the facility gym about an hour earlier. Youth A
stated that he poured water on Youth C in order to wake him up
while at the gym. Youth A believed that this made Youth C upset
and caused the beginning of the interaction when in the unit later.
Youth A stated that the whole unit returned to their building after
that and once they all started to settle in their rooms for the
afternoon, he and Youth C escalated again. Youth A recalled that
Youth C attempted to fight him in Youth A's room, and that staff
were able to intervene quickly and prevent physical escalation,
although he couldn’t remember exactly which staff. He then
recalled that Staff 1 was involved in this part of the incident
because he remembered that she hurt her hand as she was
shoved out of the way. He stated that after Youth C returned to his
own room, Youth A ran over and wanted to fight him there. Youth
A stated that he had grabbed a couple of pencils from his room
and remembered wanting to stab Youth C. He stated that he was
not able to make contact with Youth C because Staff 2 quickly
intervened in between them, and they very quickly went to the
ground. Youth A believed that Staff 2 grabbed his neck from
behind and that they both fell down. Youth A confirmed that he
was on the ground face first with Staff 2 over the top of him. Youth
A could not clearly recall how Staff 2 was touching him or if her
weight was on him while he was on the ground. He stated that he
did not have any trouble breathing the entire time that he was on
the ground. While on the ground, Youth A stated that Staff 2 was
on top of him for about a minute or so, but could not remember
2

exactly in what position. He recalled that Staff 1 tried to take the
pencils away from his hands while he was on the ground, and that
she was eventually successful even though he did not want to
give them up. Youth A stated that he remembered yelling to Staff
2 to get off of him and Staff 2 talking to him but could not
remember exactly what she said. He stated that he eventually got
up under his own power with the help of Staff 2 and Supervisor 1.
Youth A believed that Supervisor 1 walked him to his room after
this but was not completely sure. Youth A stated that the entire
incident ended after this point in time, and that there were no more
physical interactions.
Youth B was interviewed on 04/04/2023 during an announced
face-to-face visit to the facility. He stated that he witnessed the
incident in question because his room was nearest to Youth C.
While he did not see Youth A on the ground for very long, he did
remember seeing Youth A and Staff 2 go to the ground. Youth B
stated that he did not believe anything incorrect occurred because
Youth A was very escalated and trying to attack Youth C. Youth B
believed that Youth A stabbed Staff 2 on accident over the course
of the short incident. He stated that he did not see Youth A get up
from the ground because he went back in his room as instructed.
Youth C was interviewed on 04/04/2023 during an announced
face-to-face visit to the facility. He stated that he was involved in
the incident in question and remembered details from it. Youth C
stated that the entire incident started in the gym prior to returning
to their unit. Youth A had poured the contents of a water bottle on
top of Youth C’s head. Youth C recalled that staff intervened and
nothing else occurred during this part of the incident, but he could
not remember exactly which staff. He believed it was Staff 1.
Youth C recalled attempting to fight Youth A near Youth A’s room
once they got back to the unit. He noted that staff successfully
intervened between them. Within a minute or so, Youth C stated
that he was standing in the doorway of his room, and he saw
Youth A run over to it with pencils in his hand. Youth C stated that
he was ready to fight Youth A, but that never occurred because
Staff 2 intervened in between he and Youth A as Youth A
approached. He recalled that Staff 2 grabbed Youth A’s shoulders
and pushed him to the ground. Youth C did not believe that Youth
A ended up face down. He stated that he saw Staff 2 on top of
Youth A for less than a minute and another staff, he believed Staff
1, wrestling with Youth A’s hands to take the pencils away from
him.
3

Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 04/04/2023 during an
announced face-to-face visit at the facility. Supervisor 1 stated
that his involvement with the incident began with him being in the
main building on campus when he was alerted to an altercation
beginning in the unit. He stated that he then ran to the unit. When
Supervisor 1 entered, he quickly called an “emergency procedure”
which is when every youth goes into their rooms with their doors
open to allow for de-escalation to occur with anyone who is
struggling. Supervisor 1 stated that he was working to get Youth B
into his own room when he turned around and saw the part of the
incident where Staff 2 and Youth A fell to the floor. At that point in
time Supervisor 1 recalled Staff 1 being in their vicinity but not yet
being physically involved in the incident. Supervisor 1 stated that
he could not exactly say how or why Youth A and Staff 2 fell to the
ground, but did state that he believed Youth A was very escalated
and looking to attack either Staff 2 or Youth C at that point.
Supervisor 1 stated that his first sight was the two individuals
falling and seeing Staff 2 on the left side of Youth A. Supervisor 1
stated that he saw Youth A fall and stay face down on the ground.
Supervisor 1 believed it only took him a couple of seconds to run
over to the three individuals. During this entire part of the incident,
Supervisor 1 stated that Youth A was cussing and swearing and
threatening Youth C. Supervisor 1 recalled that when he first
approached Youth A and Staff 2, he stepped over to Youth A’s
right side to allow Staff 2 to get off of Youth A and not put any
weight on him. Supervisor 1 stated that he had his hand on the
back of Youth A’s shoulder and that he immediately was telling
him “We need to get you off the floor” and “May we pick you up.”
Supervisor 1 stated that his objective in that moment was to get
Youth A up off the ground fully. Supervisor 1 stated that Youth A
still had the pencils in his hand that he had previously tried to
attack Youth C and/or Staff 2 with, and Staff 1 was able to get
those out of Youth A’s hand after an initial struggle, because
Youth A did not appear to want to give them up. Supervisor 1
stated that it only took about 45 seconds for Youth A to appear
ready to comply and he and Staff 2 lifted Youth A off the ground.
Supervisor 1 recalled that Youth A got up under his own power
and helped walk him to his room. Supervisor 1 stated that he just
had his hands around Youth A’s shoulder at this point and that
Youth A was walking voluntarily. Supervisor 1 stated that Youth A
was still very upset after this incident but that there were no other
instances of physical contact with him, despite that afterwards.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 04/04/2023 during an announced face-
to-face visit at the facility. She recalled being involved in the
incident in question. Staff 1 stated that she was the staff who was
4

with the youth in the gym when Youth A poured water over Youth
C’s head, causing him to be upset. Staff 1 stated that there was
no physical escalation during this part of the incident, and she
stated that the unit returned to their building sometime later. As
the youth were settling down in their rooms with their doors open,
Youth C went over to Youth A’s room and started to escalate.
Staff 1 stated that she saw Youth C attempt to throw punches at
Youth A, but that Staff 2 was in between them with her hands up
and was able to keep the two youth apart in some form. Staff 1
stated that she ran over to the situation and in doing so Youth C
shoved her down into a nearby couch as he walked away. Staff 1
recalled hurting her wrist in the fall and it took her a minute to get
back up and moving around. Staff 1 stated that Youth A was pretty
escalated at this point in time, yelling at Youth C and threatening
him as well as attempting to get past Staff 2. Staff 1 stated the
next thing she remembered was that Staff 2 was able to verbally
redirect Youth C to his own room, only to see Youth A run past her
with two pencils in his hands. Staff 1 stated that Youth A tried to
get around Staff 2 to Youth C and was using a stabbing motion
with the pencils. Staff 1 believed that Staff 2 was hit by Youth A
during this part of the interaction. She recalled hearing Youth A
yelling “I’m going to kill” Youth C, as well as how he was going to
“slice him in his sleep.” Staff 1 stated as she was approaching she
saw Youth A and Staff 2 fall to the ground, but could not see what
exactly caused this. Staff 1 recalled that Youth A was lying face
down when he first was on the ground and that she immediately
attempted to get the pencils out of his hands. Staff 1 stated that
she was able to do this after a short struggle. Staff 1 believed that
Youth A was only on the ground for 30 seconds or so, and that
Staff 2 and Supervisor 1 were able to calm him and help him get
up to the point where he was less of a safety risk. Staff 1 believed
that Supervisor 1 took Youth A to his room at that point. She was
not around Youth A for the next few hours.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 04/04/2023 during an announced face-
to-face visit at the facility. Supervisor 2 sat in on the interview as
well as he is the facility operations manager and the main trainer
for their chosen restraint model. She stated that she was with Staff
1 and the rest of the youth in the unit while at the gym when Youth
A dumped water on Youth C, and Staff 2 believed that this was
the beginning of the entire incident. She stated that there were no
signs of pending physical aggression or escalation immediately
after that, or as the unit walked back to their building and settled
into their rooms. Staff 2 stated that once everyone was back in the
unit and in the rooms, she was concerned that Youth C was going
to escalate, and she called Supervisor 1 to ask for assistance.
5

Staff 2 recalled that Youth C went over to Youth A’s room and
attempted to fight Youth A. Staff 2 stated that she was able to get
in between the youth to attempt to prevent any punches from
landing and that she caught a punch in the chest from Youth C in
the process. She also recalled that Youth A swung a chair and hit
her in the process of blocking him from hitting Youth C. Very
quickly Youth C returned to his own room from what Staff 2 could
recall. Staff 2 stated that she followed Youth C in an attempt to
make sure he stayed in his room and was not directly near Youth
A at this point during the incident. She stated that she next saw
Youth A as he was running towards both of them and she noticed
that he had pencils in his hands. She stated that she was stabbed
in her front shoulder by one of the pencils as Youth A was trying to
get to Youth C, but that this was caused by her attempting to stay
in between the youth. She stated that Youth A was swinging wildly
at this point. Staff 2 stated that she attempted to put her hands on
Youth A near his shirt collar in order to better control him and that,
in doing so, they both went to the ground. Staff 2 recalled that
Youth A fell face first and was lying face down on the ground at
that point. Staff 2 stated that she moved herself off of Youth A’s
back and attempted to hold his wrist down so that Staff 1 could
take the pencils away from him. Staff 2 recalled Youth A was
cussing and screaming, stating something to the effect of “I’m still
going to kill” Youth C. Staff 2 stated that she was still over the
back of Youth A at this point, but that she was on her knees and
doing everything she could to not put weight on him. She recalled
that Supervisor 1 quickly came over and Staff 2 was able to let go
of Youth A’s right wrist, so that Supervisor 1 could take it and
assist in trying to de-escalate Youth A. Staff 2 stated that this part
of the incident lasted only about a minute and that Youth A got up
under his own power and Supervisor 1 assisted in removing Youth
A from the area near Youth C’s room. Staff 2 recalled that Youth A
attempted to shove her on his way, getting up from being on the
ground, and that she instinctively pushed him back. At that point
Staff 2 stated that she intentionally walked away from the
situation, as Supervisor 1 was with Youth A in order to swap out
and ensure that Youth A did not continue to escalate because of
her presence. She stated that, even though she had tried to move
away from the situation, she was still concerned that he might
attempt to go back to Youth C, but he did not in that moment. Staff
2 stated that her immediate role after the incident was to help
manage the rest of the youth and that other staff worked with
Youth A as he was still upset.
Documents reviewed:
6

 CPI restraint training for Supervisor 1, Staff 1 and Staff 2
were reviewed. All three staff are up to date on training for
this chosen restraint model.
 No discipline in personnel files were noted for Supervisor 1,
Staff 1 and Staff 2.
 Training materials from the facility were reviewed. The
facility uses an approved model for restraints, Nonviolent
Crisis Intervention training through Crisis Prevention
Institute. In the facility’s policies and procedures, it states
that staff can only utilize physical management “if there is
an unanticipated or severe threat of danger to an
individual.”
 Two incident reports specific to Youth A and Youth C dated
03/18/2023 were provided. Specific to the restraint and fall
to the floor, the incident report regarding Youth C states
“Staff 2 attempted to place Youth A in a standing hold.
They were unsuccessful in doing so. Staff 2 put her hands
around the shoulder area of Youth A and used an improper
technique. This caused both to go to the ground.”
 Video footage of the incident in question was viewed. The
specific moment pertinent to this rule occurs at
approximately 12:11. During the altercation Staff 2 ended
up standing directly behind Youth A with her arms over his
shoulders. Her arms are reaching over his shoulders and
Staff 2 throws Youth A to the ground in a clockwise motion,
causing her to fall to the ground over the top of him at the
same time. After Youth A is brought to his feet, he appears
to be more calm. Staff 2 pushes Youth A in the chest.
Youth A is able to stay on his feet and is then escorted to
his room by Supervisor 1.
Analysis Through interviews with staff and youth, video and documentation
reviewed, it is found that there was a violation to this rule as Staff
2 throws Youth A down to the ground A and then pushes Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Resident restraint.
Section (2) The following restraints are strictly prohibited:
Description (e)Restraining youth in a prone position or any restraint that
restricts the youth’s airway.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation During the course of the restraint Youth A was prone on the
ground for a period of time.
Investigation Through the interviews with Youth A, Supervisor 1, Staff 1 and
Staff 2 it was determined that Youth A fell face down on to the
ground during the physical interaction with Staff 2 and remained
7

there until he was helped to his feet roughly a minute later. While
lying on his stomach in a prone position Staff 2 and Supervisor 1
had their hands on Youth A until he got up on his feet.
Documents reviewed:
 Training materials from the facility were reviewed. The
facility uses an approved model for restraints, Nonviolent
Crisis Intervention training through Crisis Prevention
Institute. Excerpts from the facility’s policies state that “in
the event that a restraint ends up on the floor due to the
student struggling the staff have the following options:
1) Disengage with the youth. If the youth is still
exhibiting dangerous behaviors and meets the criteria
for physical management, staff are able to reengage
the student once he stands up.
2) Help bring the student back up to his knees or
standing position. This needs to be done without the
use of force.
3) In extenuating circumstances students may be
transitioned to a supine position per the NCVI
advanced skills.”
 Incident report for Youth A for the incident in question. This
documentation corroborates the length of time that Youth A
was on the floor with staff and youth interviews.
 Video footage of the incident in question was viewed.
Youth A and Staff 2 fall to the ground at the 12:11 mark of
the video. Youth A is in a prone, face down position from
this point until 12:12. During the time that the youth is face
down Staff 2 and Supervisor 1 have their hands on his
wrists and shoulders and it can be seen that Staff 1
attempts to take something from his hands from 12:11 to
12:11. At 12:12 Staff 2 moves her right leg over the
backside of Youth A and kneels next to him.
Analysis Through face-to-face interviews with youth and staff, video and
documents reviewed it is determined that there was a rule
violation because Youth A was in a prone position and an
alternative physical intervention was not immediately used.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
